front.title: MPLS Transport Profile Lock Instruct and Loopback Functions

abstract.t: Two useful Operations, Administration, and Maintenance (OAM) functions in a transport network are "lock" and "loopback". The lock function enables an operator to lock a transport path such that it does not carry client traffic, but can continue to carry OAM messages and may carry test traffic. The loopback function allows an operator to set a specific node on the transport path into loopback mode such that it returns all received data.</t><t> This document specifies the lock function for MPLS networks and describes how the loopback function operates in MPLS networks.</t><t> This document updates Sections 7.1.1 and 7.1.2 of RFC 6371. [STANDARDS-TRACK]
